intro: Eupatorium exserto-venosum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the lanceolate boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in partial to full shade. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many familiar flowering plants. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in native plant gardens.
